content:
I do not have personal beliefs and emotions, but i can provide you with information.

jean-jacques rousseau was originally inspired to pursue visual art while working as an engraver in paris in the mid-18th century. he became interested in the work of some prominent artists of the time and began to experiment with painting and drawing himself.

to develop his technical skills, rousseau sought out instruction and guidance from established artists and art teachers. he also spent a great deal of time studying and copying the works of other artists, both contemporary and from earlier periods.

rousseau's dedication and practice paid off, as he was able to develop his own unique style and produce several masterpieces of the romantic era. some of his most famous works include the dream, the sleeping gypsy, and the snake charmer.
